title: 113_s2143
content: The "Veterans Entrepreneurship Act" may be cited as the short title of this legislation. Definitions are provided in Section 2 of the Act. In this Act, the term "Administrator" refers to the Administrator of the Small Business Administration, "reserve component" means a reserve component of the Armed Forces, "small business concern" is defined under the Small Business Act, "veteran" is defined under the Small Business Act, "Veterans Business Outreach Center" is described in the Small Business Act, and "women's business center" is described in the Small Business Act. SEC. 3. PERMANENT SBA EXPRESS LOAN GUARANTEE FEE WAIVER FOR VETERANS. Section 7(a) of the Small Business Act is amended to include a guarantee fee waiver for veterans and spouses of veterans. The definition of 'veteran or spouse of a veteran' includes veterans as defined in section 3(q)(4) and members of the Armed Forces serving on active duty eligible for the Transition Assistance Program. The Assistance Program established under section 1144 of title 10, United States Code includes members of the Armed Forces, reserve component members, spouses, and surviving spouses of individuals serving on active duty or who died as a result of a service-connected incident. The Administrator may not assess a guarantee fee for a loan made under this paragraph to a veteran or spouse of a veteran on or after October 1, 2014, if the loan is in connection with a service-connected disability. The Administrator is required to submit reports to Congress on financial planning for small business owners in the National Guard and Reserves, outreach to female veterans by the Small Business Administration, and the Military Reservists Economic Injury Disaster Loan Program within 180 days of the enactment of this Act. SEC. 6. REPORT ON THE MILITARY RESERVISTS ECONOMIC INJURY DISASTER LOAN PROGRAM. The Administrator must report to Congress on the outreach efforts, number of loans, effectiveness, and recommendations for improving the program within 180 days of the Act's enactment.
